intro: Arthrostemma grandiflorum, commonly known as the large-flowered arthrostemma, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stem. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. The flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn, making it a valuable addition to gardens and natural landscapes.
